headline.main: Los Angeles Sues Developer of Torched Apartment for $20 Million
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Sues Developer of Torched Apartment for $20 Million

docs.snippet: The city of Los Angeles filed a $20 million lawsuit on Thursday against the real estate developer behind a downtown apartment complex destroyed while under construction in a massive arson fire that engulfed an entire city block in December 2014....
docs.lead_paragraph: The city of Los Angeles filed a $20 million lawsuit on Thursday against the real estate developer behind a downtown apartment complex destroyed while under construction in a massive arson fire that engulfed an entire city block in December 2014.

headline.main: Rare Spider-Man Comic Sells at Auction for $454,100
headline.print_headline: Rare Spider-Man Comic Sells at Auction for $454,100

docs.snippet: A Dallas-based auction house says a rare copy of a comic book featuring the first appearance of Spider-Man has sold for $454,100....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Dallas-based auction house says a rare copy of a comic book featuring the first appearance of Spider-Man has sold for $454,100.

headline.main: At Oscars, the Name on Lips and Envelopes Is 'Chivo'
headline.print_headline: At Oscars, the Name on Lips and Envelopes Is 'Chivo'

docs.snippet: No name resonates in Hollywood right now quite like "Chivo."...
docs.lead_paragraph: No name resonates in Hollywood right now quite like "Chivo."

headline.main: NBC Picks Some Key Broadway Creators for Its 'Hairspray'
headline.print_headline: NBC Picks Some Key Broadway Creators for Its 'Hairspray'

headline.main: ACLU Sues Kansas Over Citizenship Documents for Voting
headline.print_headline: ACLU Sues Kansas Over Citizenship Documents for Voting

docs.snippet: People trying to register to vote at Kansas motor vehicle offices are being forced to provide documentary proof of citizenship in violation of federal law, according to a lawsuit filed Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: People trying to register to vote at Kansas motor vehicle offices are being forced to provide documentary proof of citizenship in violation of federal law, according to a lawsuit filed Thursday.

headline.main: High School Coach Retires After Scuffling With Student
headline.print_headline: High School Coach Retires After Scuffling With Student

docs.snippet: A Maryland private high school announced the retirement of its longtime football coach Thursday after a player said the coach tried to choke him while kneeling on his chest in a recorded interaction that the student said began as horseplay....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Maryland private high school announced the retirement of its longtime football coach Thursday after a player said the coach tried to choke him while kneeling on his chest in a recorded interaction that the student said began as horseplay.

headline.main: Transcript: Pope Francis on Donald Trump and Immigration
headline.print_headline: Transcript: Pope Francis on Donald Trump and Immigration

docs.snippet: Here is the full question-and-answer aboard the papal plane between a reporter and Pope Francis about Donald Trump's pledge to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexican border and deport 11 million people who are living in the country illegally....
docs.lead_paragraph: Here is the full question-and-answer aboard the papal plane between a reporter and Pope Francis about Donald Trump's pledge to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexican border and deport 11 million people who are living in the country illegally.

headline.main: Citi Raises CEO Corbat's Pay by 27 Percent in 2015
headline.print_headline: Citi Raises CEO Corbat's Pay by 27 Percent in 2015

docs.snippet: Citigroup Inc raised Chief Executive Michael Corbat's pay by an estimated 27 percent in 2015, a year in which the bank's profit more than doubled....
docs.lead_paragraph: Citigroup Inc raised Chief Executive Michael Corbat's pay by an estimated 27 percent in 2015, a year in which the bank's profit more than doubled.

headline.print_headline: Virginia Considers Keeping Police Officer Names Secret

docs.snippet: Should the government be allowed to keep the names of police officers secret from the news media and public?...

headline.main: Russian Arms Sale to Iran Without Approval Would Violate Ban: U.S
headline.print_headline: Russian Arms Sale to Iran Without Approval Would Violate Ban: U.S

docs.snippet: A reported sale of Russian combat aircraft to Iran would violate a U.N. arms embargo if it occurred without advance U.N. Security Council approval, the U.S. State Department said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A reported sale of Russian combat aircraft to Iran would violate a U.N. arms embargo if it occurred without advance U.N. Security Council approval, the U.S. State Department said on Thursday.
